headline: Trump gets tariffs; Americans get price hikes
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. President Donald Trump is getting his tariffs.  Companies are making it clear how they intend to deal with it - passing them on to American consumers.  Throughout the spring, big retailers and consumer product makers warned that levies on imported goods would squeeze their operations, forcing them to choose between lower earnings and passing on higher costs to customers.

headline: P&G estimates $1 bn tariff hit, plans some US price hikes
summary: Procter & Gamble executives projected a $1 billion hit from US tariffs over the next year on Tuesday as the consumer products giant said it would institute limited price hikes in the United States.But P&G executives said they don't have enough details about the just-announced deal between the United States and Europe to update the forecast.

headline: Analysis-The most precarious job in America's boardrooms: CEO
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -U.S. companies are removing their CEOs at the fastest clip in two decades, data shows, as increased scrutiny from shareholders and boards result in reduced tolerance for sub-par returns or wayward conduct.  At least 41 CEOs have exited S&P 500 companies so far this year, compared with 49 for all of 2024 – making the fastest pace on an annualized basis since 2005, according to data from nonprofit executive research group The Conference Board and data analytics company ESGAUGE.  In the latest example, consumer goods company Procter & Gamble, the maker of Tide laundry detergent and Bounty paper towels, said on Monday CEO Jon Moeller will be replaced next year by longtime executive Shailesh Jejurikar.

raw.headline: Analysis-The most precarious job in America's boardrooms: CEO
raw.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -U.S. companies are removing their CEOs at the fastest clip in two decades, data shows, as increased scrutiny from shareholders and boards result in reduced tolerance for sub-par returns or wayward conduct.  At least 41 CEOs have exited S&P 500 companies so far this year, compared with 49 for all of 2024 – making the fastest pace on an annualized basis since 2005, according to data from nonprofit executive research group The Conference Board and data analytics company ESGAUGE.  In the latest example, consumer goods company Procter & Gamble, the maker of Tide laundry detergent and Bounty paper towels, said on Monday CEO Jon Moeller will be replaced next year by longtime executive Shailesh Jejurikar.

headline: P&G, Spotify, Whirlpool earnings disappoint: Why it matters
summary: Tuesday's earnings weakness could signal looming risks to recent market momentum. P&G (PG) results show Trump's tariffs are weighing, while Spotify (SPOT) highlights potential market frothiness and Whirlpool (WHR) underlines weak consumer sentiment. Piper Sandler chief investment strategist Michael Kantrowitz and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporters Ines Ferré and Brooke DiPalma join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to examine what the earnings prints could mean for the wider market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid here.

headline: P&G CEO warns of tariff hit, talks decision to step down
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) reported fourth quarter results, warning that it will take a $1 billion hit from tariffs in full-year 2026. The company also announced COO Shailesh Jejurikar will take over the CEO role from Jon Moeller on Jan. 1, 2026. Moeller will remain as the company's executive chairman. He spoke to Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about the results and decision to step down. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid here.

raw.headline: P&G CEO warns of tariff hit, talks decision to step down

The company also announced COO Shailesh Jejurikar will take over the CEO role from Jon Moeller on Jan. 1, 2026. Moeller will remain as the company's executive chairman. He spoke to Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about the results and decision to step down. headline: P&G to increase prices in part due to tariffs as shoppers remain cautious and delay purchases
summary: Consumer products giant Procter & Gamble offered an annual earnings outlook that was below analysts' projections and said it would raise prices on about a quarter of its products in the U.S. in part due to higher costs from President Donald Trump's tariffs.  The assessment delivered Tuesday comes a day after the Cincinnati-based maker of such products as Crest toothpaste, Tide detergent and Charmin toilet paper, named Shailesh Jejurikar, currently chief operating officer, to succeed Jon Moeller as the company president and CEO, effective Jan. 1, 2026.  Moeller, who has been at the company's helm since November 2021, will become P&G's executive chairman.

raw.headline: P&G to increase prices in part due to tariffs as shoppers remain cautious and delay purchases
raw.summary: Consumer products giant Procter & Gamble offered an annual earnings outlook that was below analysts' projections and said it would raise prices on about a quarter of its products in the U.S. in part due to higher costs from President Donald Trump's tariffs.  The assessment delivered Tuesday comes a day after the Cincinnati-based maker of such products as Crest toothpaste, Tide detergent and Charmin toilet paper, named Shailesh Jejurikar, currently chief operating officer, to succeed Jon Moeller as the company president and CEO, effective Jan. 1, 2026.  Moeller, who has been at the company's helm since November 2021, will become P&G's executive chairman.

headline: P&G Earnings: Consumers Are Delaying Purchases, Shopping Less Often
summary: Procter & Gamble, a bellwether for the consumer economy, says shoppers in the U.S. and Western Europe are slowing down.    Consumers are using up their pantry inventory, delaying purchases and shopping less frequently to avoid buying things they don’t immediately need, P&G said.

headline: Procter & Gamble hikes US prices amid tariff challenges, CEO change
summary: (Reuters) -Procter & Gamble on Tuesday forecast annual results largely below estimates and said it would raise prices on some products in the U.S., a day after naming insider Shailesh Jejurikar as CEO to steer it through tariff uncertainty.  The consumer goods bellwether's shares rose nearly 1% in premarket trading as it topped fourth-quarter estimates.  P&G said it would raise prices on about a quarter of its products in the U.S., starting this month, to help offset the cost of new tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.

raw.headline: Procter & Gamble hikes US prices amid tariff challenges, CEO change
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Procter & Gamble on Tuesday forecast annual results largely below estimates and said it would raise prices on some products in the U.S., a day after naming insider Shailesh Jejurikar as CEO to steer it through tariff uncertainty.  The consumer goods bellwether's shares rose nearly 1% in premarket trading as it topped fourth-quarter estimates.  P&G said it would raise prices on about a quarter of its products in the U.S., starting this month, to help offset the cost of new tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.
